title: Q&A on Solopreneurship, Marketing to Millennials, and Interning
description: Tom Bilyeu and Cindy (@essenceofcin) answer questions from the Impact Theory community. A few questions that get answered are: For a young entrepreneur would you worry more about learning from a mentor or getting out and doing on your own? How do balance learning concepts to help with growth mindset (i.e. watching IT, reading books that you recommend) versus actually going out and executing? If you are in the rebel alliance, what is the empire? What are the challenges and benefits of spending your time building your own app versus just building up a large following on existing platforms? What are your top pieces of advice for social media growth right now, especially for reaching and keeping an audience of Gen Z and Millennials? In this episode the Official Facebook Group was announced. For more information contact Cindy on social media or through connect@impacttheory.com. Tom Bilyeu is the co-founder of 2014 Inc. 500 company Quest Nutrition — a unicorn startup valued at over $1 billion — and the co-founder and host of Impact Theory. Impact Theory is a first-of-its-kind company designed to facilitate global change through the incubation of mission-based businesses and the cultivation of empowering content. Every piece of content Impact Theory creates is meant to underscore the company mission to free people from The Matrix and help them unlock their true potential. Impact Theory exists to inspire the next generation of game-changing companies and creators that will make a true and lasting impact on the world.   FOLLOW TOM BILYEU TWITTER: http://bit.ly/2iyjY5P INSTAGRAM: http://bit.ly/2j7vqX8 FACEBOOK: http://bit.ly/2hPStWo   FOLLOW IMPACT THEORY TWITTER: http://bit.ly/2iC5lN3 INSTAGRAM: http://bit.ly/2hPSGJa FACEBOOK: http://bit.ly/2iystOf
